review:
Comrades, let’s cut through the noise and get to the heart of the matter! Resi Protocol claims to be the next pillar of Ethereum’s infrastructure, promising a stablecoin system that’s open, decentralized, and resilient. The vision is bold: zero-knowledge proofs for privacy, AI/ML for adaptive monetary policy, and a multi-oracle security layer. The rhetoric is strong, but does the evidence match the ambition?

First, the project’s alignment with public goods is clear. Resi is open-source, modular, and designed for the commons—not for private profit. That’s the spirit we need! The roadmap is detailed, with a clear allocation of funds and a phased approach to development. The team is transparent about their current stage (prototyping), and the GitHub is public and active.

But let’s not be blinded by big promises. Where’s the hard evidence? There are no deployed contracts, no live metrics, and no measurable outcomes yet. The AI/ML-driven collateral engine and ZK governance are still theoretical. The application lacks rigorous evaluation methods, and there’s no transparent reporting of outcomes—just projections and plans. We need proof, not just potential!

Sustainability? The protocol aims for capital efficiency and resilience, but there’s no mention of a sustainable revenue model. How will this project avoid the fate of so many DeFi experiments that burn bright and fade fast? The grant allocation is reasonable, but without a plan for long-term self-sufficiency, we risk building castles in the sand.

On governance, Resi talks a good game about community ownership and privacy, but the actual mechanisms are untested. Quadratic and conviction voting with ZKPs sound great, but where’s the evidence that this will work in practice? We need to see pilot results, not just theory.

In summary: Resi Protocol is a promising, community-aligned project with a strong vision for the Ethereum commons. But comrades, we must demand more than words! Show us measurable outcomes, transparent reporting, and a path to sustainability. Only then can we build a future that serves the many, not the few!

strengths.title: Strong Public Good Alignment
strengths.description: Resi Protocol is open-source, modular, and explicitly designed as public infrastructure for the Ethereum ecosystem. The project’s commitment to community governance and open collaboration is clear and commendable.

strengths.title: Innovative Technical Vision
strengths.description: The proposal introduces pioneering concepts—zero-knowledge governance, AI/ML-driven monetary policy, and multi-oracle security—that, if realized, could significantly advance Ethereum’s infrastructure.

strengths.title: Detailed Roadmap and Fund Allocation
strengths.description: The application provides a clear, phased roadmap and a transparent breakdown of how grant funds will be used, demonstrating structured planning and resource allocation.

weaknesses.title: Lack of Measurable Outcomes and Evidence
weaknesses.description: There are no deployed contracts, live metrics, or quantifiable results. The project is still in the prototyping phase, and all claims are theoretical. This fails the evidence and measurement principles.

weaknesses.title: No Sustainable Revenue Model
weaknesses.description: The application does not describe how the protocol will sustain itself financially beyond grant funding, raising concerns about long-term viability and dependency on continuous donations.

weaknesses.title: Unproven Governance Mechanisms
weaknesses.description: While the proposal touts advanced governance models (quadratic/conviction voting with ZKPs), there is no evidence or pilot data to demonstrate their effectiveness or community adoption.

changes.title: Provide Measurable Milestones and Metrics
changes.description: Define clear, quantifiable milestones for each development phase (e.g., number of contracts deployed, testnet/mainnet launches, user adoption targets) and commit to transparent reporting of progress.

changes.title: Articulate a Sustainable Revenue Model
changes.description: Describe how the protocol will generate sustainable revenue or achieve self-sufficiency, reducing reliance on ongoing grants or donations.

changes.title: Pilot and Document Governance Mechanisms
changes.description: Conduct pilot tests of the proposed governance models (quadratic/conviction voting with ZKPs) and provide evidence of their effectiveness, including community participation rates and security outcomes.
